meanings.definition: To put pants on a child.
meanings.sent1: She breeched her toddler before they went out.
meanings.sent2: The mother breeched her baby boy in cute overalls.
meanings.sent3: The little one giggled as he was breeched in his new trousers.
meanings.sent4: The nursery rhyme character breeched the young prince in royal attire.
meanings.sent5: The child felt proud when breeched in his first pair of jeans.

meanings.sent1: The determined athlete breeched the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight breeched through the clouds after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel breeched the bird feeder despite its defenses.
meanings.sent4: Her smile breeched the tough exterior of his heart.
meanings.sent5: The river breeched the dam, flooding the valley below.

meanings.definition: To arm a ship with guns.
meanings.sent1: The navy breeched the warship before setting sail.
meanings.sent2: The pirates breeched their ship with cannons for battle.
meanings.sent3: The crew cheered as they breeched the vessel with firepower.
meanings.sent4: The historical warship breeched for combat in the open sea.
meanings.sent5: The captain ordered to breech the ship before engaging the enemy.
